resources.string: Show the notification text around the ring.
Show all notifications including ongoing, non-clearable notifications.
Hide low priority notifications such as those from Google Now.
Show active display notifications when you take the device out of your pocket.
Invert the colors when in areas with bright light such as direct sunlight.
Excluded applications will not show up in active display.
Brightness level for displaying notifications when automatic brightness is not enabled.
Show the date above the clock
Show AM/PM indicator next to time when using 12hour format
Turn off display if the device gets pocketed again and was turned on by Active Display.
Enter a name for the new application group
Add, remove, and position items in the @ppbar
Position the Appbar on the left or right side of the screen
Display a visible tab on the side which will display the \@appbar when touched.
Display the tab on the top, middle, or bottom on the side of the screen.
Change the size of the visible tab.
Adjust the width of the trigger area
Adjust the vertical postion of the trigger area
Adjust the height of the trigger area
"Changing permissions of core Android components might lead to undesired behavior. Change settings here at your own risk!
Must draw gesture to unlock screen
How to draw an unlock gesture
Tick to show or untick to hide the clear all button within the recent applications screen
Choose in which corner the clear all recent apps button is shown

This rambar shows how android is really using your available ram. Please note that having apps open in the background and cached helps for your device to open your apps faster. For further explanations on how android memory (RAM) managment works, please follow the help button in the menu.
Reset all style entries to default?
Reset all style and dimensions entries to default?
Reset network stats color to default?
Hide when there is no traffic
Hide network stats indicator when there is no traffic
Please enter a new label. Leave blank to revert to stock label.
An alternative notification interface that launches apps as floating windows
Halo will appear for incoming tasks and scroll out of sight after a while
Applies for task switching and moving gestures
When opening an app with Halo the underlying app will get paused
Halo will disappear completely when empty
Show message box for incoming notifications
Halo will ping when device is unlocked if new notifications were received
Defines how big Halo is going to be
Halo message box animation for incoming notifications
When enabled, this option will allow you to change the brightness by sliding your finger across the Statusbar. Note: Will not be active when auto-brightness is on
Actions will be executed on screen off. On screen on the previous state will be restored.
Network mode will be switched to 2G on screen off
GPS based location service will be disabled on screen off
Mobile data will be disabled on screen off
Blocking wakelocks have the potential to cause instability, crashes or data loss.
An error occurred.\n\nPlease check for root access. To activate go into superuser settings and enable root access.
Tablets and older phones use 160. Most phones use 240.
This step clears data from market, google play services and google services framework.
Come back here after the reboot and complete the rest of the steps!
Press back when done to return here.
"Couldn't open the market! If you're sure it's installed, open it yourself from the launcher."
Some values may cause compatibility issues with apps and the playstore, use at your own RISK!
"Changing your LCD density can cause unexpected app behavior. If you encounter market app incompatibility please return here and restart the process from step 1."
Be Advised that it is recommended to use a Multi-DPI Play Store to avoid any issues with apps after changing your system density. Do you understand?

What is the difference between Paranoid or Slim PIE? 

 Paranoid PIE control is wavely based on simple navigation to expanded desktop. Slim PIE Control is more about customizable targets, colors of the chevrons and easy to use to navigate to any of your apps or activity. The difference is all about user choices.
Acts like a navigation bar, but without expanded desktop experience and has multiple targets, customization
Controls through your expanded desktop experience
Allows navigation and status report on expanded desktop mode
Select the location where the pie will be placed at
Manage how animations and status additions will be handled
Adjust the angle of pie bords from pie attach
Whether or not the menu button will appear when unneeded
Access to Google Now via Pie
Enable last app button on Pie
Enable power button on pie controls
Enable kill task button on Pie
Enable app window button on Pie (configure app window in Ribbon settings)
Center Pie on the trigger edge
If checked Pie will stay in place no matter which orientation
Allows your launcher to regain sanity after a screensize change (recommended)
Enabling will let the Notification panel and QuickSettings activate when swiped
Adjust the gap in between pie elements
Determine the size of the triggering area that will start pie controls
Show music widget while music is playing
Turn screen on and show all notifications when device is pulled out of pocket. Turn screen off when device gets back into pocket.
Always turn screen on when pulled out of pocket, even when there are no notifications pending
Hide low priority notifications such as google now weather notifications
Allow dismissing even non clearable notifications. Of course, they\'re just hidden from lockscreen and not from the notification panel.
Show notifications expanded by default. You still will be able to toggle between expanded and normal view.
Wake device when a new notification is received
Number of notifications displayed at once
Offset to the top of the screen:
Disables notifications from being shown and dismissed. This way, you just see the icons of your notifications.
Use custom application instead of the recent applications dialog
Whether to pull weather information and display it throughout the ROM.
Setting a custom location can save some battery. Otherwise network-location is used to determine your location.

Be sure to follow the examples! Setting an invalid location will stop you from getting weather updates and may cause unexpected behavior.\n\nExamples: New York,NY // New York, NY // 10033 // London, England
Unable to retrieve location information for weather update
Enabling this will display weather temperature in Celsius rather than Fahrenheit and windspeed in km/h rather than mph.

"Obtaining location from network is currently disabled. This breaks the ability to get the current weather in your current location. Please set a custom location or enable obtaining your location from your network."
Start and end points as percentage of screen size
Stop touches in zones from reaching the application
The selected gesture area is too large and will not be set.
The charging animation may result in a poor user experience. Enable at your own discretion.
